div.h1: Update on Distribution of Educational Materials

p.strong: CUSD Is Having A SECOND ROUND OF ELA PACKETS DISTRIBUTED (SAME AS LAST TIME)

span.strong: Chester Upland School District will be distributing a second round of the SAME packets that were distributed last time. If you did not get a chance to get the last packets, this is your second chance.

span.span: Stetser and Chester High School - for Students Kindergarten - 6th Grade
Toby Farms - for students Kindergarten - 8th Grade

p.strong: ** K - 8th Grade Resource Packets are only for students who do not have internet access and/or a computer device available to them**

hr.p: CUSD está teniendo una SEGUNDA RONDA DE PAQUETES ELA DISTRIBUIDOS (IGUAL A LA ÚLTIMA VEZ)

El Distrito Escolar Chester Upland distribuirá una segunda ronda de los MISMOS paquetes que se distribuyeron la última vez. Si no tuvo la oportunidad de obtener los últimos paquetes, esta es su segunda oportunidad.

span.strong: Stetser y Chester High School - para estudiantes - Jardín de infancia - 6th
Toby Farms - para estudiantes - Jardín de infancia

p.strong: ** K - Los paquetes de recursos de 8º grado son solo para estudiantes que no tienen acceso a Internet y / o un dispositivo informático disponible **

div.p: The Chester Upland School District will be completing registration for students enrolling for remote learning during the 2019-2020 school-year. Registration will be completed in the Chester High School Main Office;
Monday - Thursday during the hours of 10:00am - 12:30pm. Start Date will be Thursday, April 23, 2020.
Please contact Pauline Boneparte to schedule an appointment at 610-447-3880 or pboneparte@chesteruplandsd.org
To ensure the safety of everyone, all individuals must wear a mask and practice social distancing of six feet. Only one person will be allowed access to the main office at a time.

hr.p:
El Distrito Escolar Chester Upland completará la inscripción para los estudiantes que se matriculan para el aprendizaje remoto durante el año escolar 2019-2020. La inscripción se completará en la oficina principal de Chester High School; De lunes a jueves de 10:00 a.m. a 12:30 p.m. La fecha de inicio será el jueves 23 de abril de 2020
Comuníquese con Pauline Boneparte para programar una cita al 610-447-3880 o pboneparte@chesteruplandsd.org
Para garantizar la seguridad de todos, todas las personas deben usar una máscara y practicar el distanciamiento social de seis pies. Solo una persona tendrá acceso a la oficina principal a la vez.

span.span: GOOGLE CLASSROOM CHEAT SHEET FOR STUDENTS

a.span: Please "Click Here" for useful tips on how to get on and use Google Classroom

strong.span: Tips for your Social and Emotional Wellness: ”SEW” important, especially now!

hr.p: The Coronavirus pandemic has us all focusing on our physical health, causing us to hope we don’t have the illness each time we cough, sniffle, or sneeze. As important, however, is our social and emotional wellness (SEW), especially since our normal daily actions have been placed on hold as we try to follow the advice to stay home and practice social distancing. This means we find ourselves sometimes struggling with the anxiety that can come from being “cooped up…” from sharing space, to having more noise around us all day, to providing activities for children normally in school. Some of us may be feeling very lonely since we can’t get out and mingle with other people. Then there are the economic concerns of experiencing lost or reduced income with bills still to pay and families still to feed. All these realities may lead to STRESS, and we all know the harmful impact of stress on our bodies, minds, and spirits. For this reason, twice a week, the CUSD website will provide tips for taking care of your social and emotional wellness. We need each adult to be physically, socially, and emotionally well so you can be your best for our young people. These will be called “SEW” Tips, and below are the first few:

p.strong: SEW Tip #9: Capturing Me at my Best

hr.p: It has now been more than a month since we have been practicing social distancing. For some, limiting personal interaction may have been easier to do than for others. People who are truly energized by being with other people may have found that they are not at their best with social restrictions. Some of you may really be struggling to feel your best self. So here is an invitation to come up with new ways of defining you at your best, even when you are not around other people as much as you would like. Are you an awesome cook, able to take whatever is around and make a delicious meal? Do you dance well and find that when good music is on, you can break out in a sweat moving to the beat, even if no one is watching? Do you sing, not really aiming to please anyone but yourself with notes that may or may not be in tune? Are you a master at cleaning, at rapping, at doing your hair, putting on makeup, or rearranging furniture? The aim of capturing yourself at your best is to think of something you enjoy doing and think you do well, even if you are the only one around to appreciate it. Focusing on your best self is important for social and emotional wellness because it takes your attention away from the negative and places it on the positive. It helps you regulate your emotions and remain self-aware of your good traits and talents, even when there may not be many others around to sing your praise. To capture an image of you at your best should you need occasional reminders, use your cell phone and take a picture of whatever you accomplished that serves as evidence of how amazing you are. Send it to family members and friends you would be relying on for compliments and praise if there were no social distancing. If you use social media, post a picture of what you did that made you feel proud. By publicizing your best self, you will be keeping in touch with others while getting in touch with yourself in important ways to promote social and emotional wellness.
Check out the CUSD website on Tuesdays and Thursdays for more “SEW” tips!

Todos los deportes de primavera y cualquier actividad relacionada con la escuela se cancelan hasta el momento en que volvamos a abrir.

span.p: Welcome to Chester Upland School District! Home of C-Pride!

If you have comments or questions on our site, you can reach us as via e-mail at website@chesteruplandsd.org. We're also eager for recommendations for new content to share, so if you have great news to share with the CUSD community, let us know at that address.
